items.sentence: Tom and Mary were neighbors, but seldom saw each other.
Tom and Mary would get together as often as they could.
Tom and some of his friends are planning to rob a bank.
Tom announced his intention to run for class president.
Tom asked Mary how many hours a week she spent reading.
He listened to the news on the radio as he fed his dog.
I always have a look at the newspaper before breakfast.
I asked Tom where he and Mary had first met each other.
It\'ll take Tom three hours to finish what he\'s doing.
You\'ll be paid according to the amount of work you do.
You\'ll have to work hard if you want to pass the exam.
It\'s impossible for me to believe what you are saying.
I strongly advise you to take this medicine right away.
Have you already done everything I\'ve asked you to do?
I can\'t speak French without making a lot of mistakes.
I\'m confident that Tom will do what he says he\'ll do.
I\'m going back to Boston. I\'ve had enough of Chicago.
Tom stayed up all night reading the book Mary gave him.
Tom still has one more month to go before he graduates.
Tom stopped at the convenience store for gas and water.
